member.summary: Asyncronous send method, provide an Action to handle the callback. It's the callers responsibility to validate whether the response has errors using response.HasErrors If the SDK is not connected, the default timeout will be used as defined in GSPlatform.RequestTimeoutSeconds

member.name: M:GameSparks.Core.GSTypedRequest`2.Send(System.Action{`1},System.Int32)
member.summary: Asyncronous send method, provide an Action to handle the callback. The timeoutSeconds parameter indicates how long the request will be queued for in case the SDK is not connected to the GameSparks service. It's the callers responsibility to validate whether the response has errors using response.HasErrors

member.name: M:GameSparks.Core.GSTypedRequest`2.Send(System.Action{`1},System.Action{`1})
member.summary: Asyncronous send method, provide an Action to handle a successful response and an Action to handle an error response. If the SDK is not connected, the default timeout will be used as defined in GSPlatform.RequestTimeoutSeconds

member.name: M:GameSparks.Core.GSTypedRequest`2.Send(System.Action{`1},System.Action{`1},System.Int32)
member.summary: Asyncronous send method, provide an Action to handle a successful response and an action to handle an error response. The timeoutSeconds parameter indicates how long the request will be queued for in case the SDK is not connected to the GameSparks service.

member.summary: The access token is used by the client to make authenticated requests on behalf of the end user. It has a longer lifetime than the authorization code, typically on the order of minutes or hours. When the access token expires, attempts to use it will fail, and a new access token must be obtained via a refresh token.

member.name: M:GameSparks.Api.Requests.FacebookConnectRequest.SetCode(System.String)
member.summary: An authorization code is a short-lived token representing the user's access grant, created by the authorization server and passed to the client application via the browser. The client application sends the authorization code to the authorization server to obtain an access token and, optionally, a refresh token.
